keyword: calories in a shot of whiskey
title: Calories in a Shot of Whiskey
meta_description: Discover calories in a shot of whiskey, including full nutrition breakdown, alcohol content equivalents, and variations for different proofs.
h1: Calories in a Shot of Whiskey
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) serving of 80-proof (40% ABV) straight whiskey, no mixers or additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, serving size, and any added flavors or mixers. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard shot of 80-proof whiskey contains about 97 kcal, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Flavored whiskey (e.g., honey or cinnamon variety)

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of whiskey?
faqs.a: Approximately 97 kcal for a 1.5 fl oz shot of 80-proof whiskey.

faqs.q: Does whiskey have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Straight whiskey has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in whiskey?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories; e.g., 100-proof adds about 25 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: What about sodium or fat in a shot of whiskey?
faqs.a: Typically 0 mg sodium and 0 g fat in plain whiskey shots.

faqs.q: Are calories the same for all whiskeys?
faqs.a: Noâ€”varies by proof, flavorings, and brand; straight bourbon or scotch is around 97 kcal per shot.
